data.content: Both surveys were conducted using comparable methodologies and covering the same area.
A new entry into the AED, i.e. no previous survey or guess to compare with.
The most recent survey uses a different survey methodology, or replaces a guess.

Both surveys were conducted using the same methodology, but the extent of the areas covered differed by 10% or more*

* The 10% difference is a guideline; at times, differences in areas deemed to be non-significant by reviewers in terms of capturing elephant populations (e.g. in the case of other recent surveys showing no elephants in the omitted area), may result in the assignation of other causes of change.
A guess replaces an older guess or a survey estimate that was degraded data.
A distinct population is known to have disappeared from an area, be it through translocation or local extinction.
The estimate or guess has been degraded after 10 years.
The estimate or guess has been retained unchanged from the previous report.
